feed.title: PALM Lab
feed.subtitle: The Perception, Attention and Memory Lab at the University of Adelaide.

entry.title: Associative learning changes multivariate neural signatures of visual working memory

link.title: Associative learning changes multivariate neural signatures of visual working memory

entry.content:
Slides from a talk presented by William Ngiam at VSS 2024 showing how training to learn color pairs and color triplets changes mujltivariate neural signatures of visual working memory load.

Download PDF
entry.summary: Slides from a talk presented by William Ngiam at VSS 2024 showing how training to learn color pairs and color triplets changes mujltivariate neural signatures of visual working memory load.

entry.title: Associative learning changes multivariate neural signatures of working memory load

link.title: Associative learning changes multivariate neural signatures of working memory load

entry.content:
A conference poster presented by William Ngiam at OPAM 2023 showing training to learn color pairs changes neural signatures of working memory load.

entry.title: Probing working memory pointers by examining contralateral delay activity with moving and updating stimuli

link.title: Probing working memory pointers by examining contralateral delay activity with moving and updating stimuli

entry.content:
A pre-data poster presented by Piotr Styrkowiec and William Ngiam at the Vision Sciences Society Meeting in 2023.

Download PDF
entry.summary: A pre-data poster presented by Piotr Styrkowiec and William Ngiam at the Vision Sciences Society Meeting in 2023.

entry.title: Evidence for object-based encoding into visual working memory

link.title: Evidence for object-based encoding into visual working memory

entry.content:
A conference poster presented by William Ngiam at the Vision Sciences Society Meeting in 2022, showing evidence for object-based encoding limits in visual working memory using a novel conjunction whole-report paradigm.

Download PDF
entry.summary: A conference poster presented by William Ngiam at the Vision Sciences Society Meeting in 2022, showing evidence for object-based encoding limits in visual working memory using a novel conjunction whole-report paradigm.

entry.title: Memory compression effects in visual working memory are contingent on explicit long-term memory

link.title: Memory compression effects in visual working memory are contingent on explicit long-term memory

entry.content:
A conference poster presented by William Ngiam at the Psychonomics conference in 2019, showing benefits of statistical learning required explicit awareness of the statistical regularities, suggesting a long-term memory account for the benefit.

Download PDF
entry.summary: A conference poster presented by William Ngiam at the Psychonomics conference in 2019, showing benefits of statistical learning required explicit awareness of the statistical regularities, suggesting a long-term memory account for the benefit.
